intro: Rhynchopera fastidiosa, commonly known as the slender tansy, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with narrow, lance-shaped leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and disturbed areas. Rhynchopera fastidiosa is known for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
